name: XXXTentacion
description:
'''Jahseh Dwayne Ricardo Onfroy''' (January 23, 1998 – June 18, 2018), known professionally as '''XXXTentacion''',{{efn|{{IPAc-en|lang|ɛ|k|s|.|ɛ|k|s|.|ɛ|k|s|ˌ|t|ɛ|n|.|t|ə|s|ˈ|j|oʊ|n}} {{respell|eks|eks|eks|TEN|təss|YOHN}}<ref>{{cite web|url=https://genius.com/videos/How-to-correctly-pronounce-xxxtentacion|title=How To Correctly Pronounce XXXTentacion|access-date=June 24, 2017}}</ref> {{IPA|es|tentaˈsjon}}. Alternatively stylized in all caps/lowercase throughout his career; often colloquially  referred to as '''X''' or '''Triple X'''.}} was an American rapper and singer-songwriter. Though a controversial figure due to his widely publicized legal troubles, XXXTentacion gained a [[cult following]] among his young fan base during his short career with his [[Depression (mood)|depression-]] and [[Social alienation|alienation]]-themed music. Critics and audiences often credit him for his musical versatility, with his music exploring [[emo music|emo]], [[Trap music|trap]], [[Rap metal#Trap metal|trap metal]], [[nu metal]], [[indie rock]], [[Lo-fi music|lo-fi]], [[hip-hop]], [[Contemporary R&B|R&B]], and [[punk rock]]. He was considered to be a leading figure in the establishment of the [[emo rap]] and [[SoundCloud rap]] genres, which garnered mainstream attention during the mid-to-late 2010s.

Born in [[Plantation, Florida]], XXXTentacion spent most of his childhood in [[Lauderhill, Florida|Lauderhill]]. He began writing music after being released from a [[juvenile detention center]] and soon started his music career on [[SoundCloud]] in 2013, employing styles and techniques that were unconventional in [[rap music]] such as [[Distortion (music)|distortion]] and heavy guitar-backed instrumentals, drawing inspiration from third-wave [[emo]] and [[grunge]]. In 2014, he formed the [[Underground music|underground]] collective [[Members Only (hip-hop collective)|Members Only]] and, alongside other members of the collective, soon became a popular figure in [[SoundCloud rap]], a trap music scene that takes elements of [[lo-fi music]] and harsh [[Roland TR-808|808s]]. XXXTentacion gained mainstream attention with his 2016 single "[[Look at Me!]]". His debut studio album, ''[[17 (XXXTentacion album)|17]]'' (2017), peaked at number two on the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]], while his second album, [[? (XXXTentacion album)|''?'']] (2018), debuted atop the chart; both received [[RIAA certification|triple platinum]] certifications by the [[Recording Industry Association of America]] (RIAA). The latter's lead single, "[[Sad!]]", posthumously reached number one on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] and had amassed more than 1.2 billion views on YouTube and 2.1 billion streams on [[Spotify]] by February 2024, in addition to having received [[List of best-selling singles in the United States|diamond certification]] by the RIAA in August 2021.

XXXTentacion faced a variety of [[#Legal issues|legal issues]] throughout his lifetime, most notably the controversy that arose from the [[Battery (crime)|battery]] charges that were levied against him in 2016. His history of legal issues and alleged violence has been described by some as defining his legacy, while others have criticized the media's portrayal of him, arguing that his perceived improvements in character later in life have made his legacy into a tale of the power of second chances and [[Repentance|redemption]].{{sfn|Reiss|2020|pp=248; 250; 262–263}}

On June 18, 2018, XXXTentacion, age 20, [[Murder of XXXTentacion|was murdered]] when he was shot near a motorcycle dealership in [[Deerfield Beach, Florida]]. The attackers fled the scene in an [[Sport utility vehicle|SUV]] after stealing his [[Louis Vuitton]] bag containing $50,000 in cash. Four suspects were arrested and charged with [[Murder in Florida law|first-degree murder]] among other charges. In August 2022, one of the four men [[pleaded guilty]] to second-degree murder [[Turn state's evidence|in exchange for testimony]] against the other three defendants in their trial. [[XXXTentacion murder trial|The trial]] initiated on February 7, 2023. On March 20, 2023, all three were found guilty on all counts. On April 6, 2023, they were sentenced to [[Life imprisonment in the United States|life imprisonment]] without the possibility of [[parole]].

XXXTentacion has RIAA-certified sales of 61 million units in the US, and [[BPI certification|BPI]]-certified sales of over 7 million units in the UK, bringing his total to 68 million certified records sold in the two countries. Since his death, he has won an [[American Music Awards|American Music Award]] and a [[BET Hip Hop Awards|BET Hip Hop Award]] and received 11 [[Billboard Music Award|''Billboard'' Music Award]] nominations. Two posthumous albums were released, [[Skins (XXXTentacion album)|''Skins'']] (2018) and ''[[Bad Vibes Forever]]'' (2019); the former became his second number-one album on the ''Billboard'' 200, while the latter entered the top five.
